channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023110375
item.description:
Report X-2023110375

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at INDH. The fiberboard box contained four plastic bottles each packaged in plastic bags. One of the plastic bottles had a crack on the side causing the spill inside of fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023110986
item.description:
Report X-2023110986

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE IS NOTICEABLY WET AND STAINED, DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. CONTENTS INSIDE CONTAINED 2 X 5 LITERS OF CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZING LIQUIDS. PACKAGE FAILED DUE TO LOOSEN BOTTLE CAPS CAUSING LIQUIDS TO LEAKAGE AND DAMAGE PACKAGE ENTIRELY. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.
